definition: the real body (of Buddha or a God)/true effigy
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: But Acetes suspected that some god was concealed under the youth's exterior.
sentences.chinese: 但是阿克特斯怀疑少年的真身是某位神。

sentences.english: The fishermen sailed their boats up and down the river to look for his body.
sentences.chinese: 渔夫们划起船舶，在江上来回打捞他的真身。

sentences.english: There is no real body, which in itself is a matter worthy of further argumentation.
sentences.chinese: 有没有真身，这本身就是一个值得进一步论证的事情。

sentences.english: Now that the Second Coming event is so close, it is time to come out of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 现在耶稣再临事件很近了，是时候显露真身了。

sentences.english: God is not known through natural manifestations.
sentences.chinese: 上帝不会在自然中现出真身。

sentences.english: Roses of shadow, since his rose is true?
sentences.chinese: 为什么，既然他是玫瑰花的真身。

sentences.english: The silver white land frequently hint can not drink liquor, so as not to expose mami.
sentences.chinese: 陆银频频暗示陆白不能喝白酒，以免露出真身。

definition: to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
main part/torso/the thing in itself/noumenon (object of purely intellectual perception according to Kant)
human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
occult force/the power of a God or spirit
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
